HOLY CRAP! That revolver would have a hell of a kick to it. Call me crazy, but I'd love to have a go shooting that thing.

Did a little research on that awesome weapon. It comes from Spain around 1920, though people seem to credit Belgium with it's creation. It's called the 'pistola concaricatoji', is chambered in browning 6.35mm (0.25 cal) and loads\unloads via an 18 shot speed loader, that is left inside the revolver when firing and then removed taking the spent shells with it. It is an amazing piece of firearms history and shows how creative people can be... I want one.
